panels.description: This shows how many members are configured in the replica set.
panels.title: ReplSet Members

panels.description: This shows the time since the last election.
panels.title: ReplSet Last Election

panels.description: Operations are classified by legacy wire protocol type (insert, update, and delete only).
panels.title: Operations - $service_name

panels.description: Time span between now and last heartbeat from replicaset members.

targets.expr: time() - avg by(service_name) (max by(name) (mongodb_mongod_replset_member_last_heartbeat{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$service_name"})) * on(name) group_right() avg by(service_name) (mongodb_mongod_replset_my_name{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$service_name"})

avg by(service_name) (max by(name) (mongodb_rs_heartbeatIntervalMillis{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$service_name"}) / 1000) * on(name) group_right() avg by(service_name) (mongodb_mongod_replset_my_name{juju_application="$juju_application",juju_model="$juju_model",juju_model_uuid="$juju_model_uuid",juju_unit="$juju_unit",service_name=~"$service_name"})

panels.title: Max Heartbeat Time

panels.description: Count of elections. Usually zero; 1 count by each healthy node will appear in each election. Happens when the primary role changes due to either normal maintenance or trouble events.
panels.title: Elections

panels.description: Timespan 'window' between newest and the oldest op in the Oplog collection.
panels.title: Oplog Recovery Window - $service_name

panels.description: Repl buffer ops applied per sec.
panels.title: Oplog Buffered Operations

panels.description: Time spent per second waiting for or fetching oplog docs in replication.
panels.title: Oplog Getmore Time

panels.description: Times spent per second A) pre-loading oplog ops into parallel-executable batches B) Times spent pre-loading index values and C) repl batch apply phase.
panels.title: Oplog Processing Time - $service_name

panels.description: Current hard-coded max and actual size of repl batch buffer.
panels.title: Oplog Buffer Capacity - $service_name

panels.description: Count of A) getmores executed B) index values pre-loaded C) oplog docs applied per second against oplog collection in replication.
panels.title: Oplog Operations - $service_name

panels.description: Average latency of operations (classified by read, write, or (other) command).
panels.title: Latency Detail - $service_name

panels.description: Docs per second inserted, updated, deleted or returned. (N.b. not 1-to-1 with operation counts.)
panels.title: Document Operations - $service_name

panels.description: MongoDB keeps most recently used data in RAM. If you have created indexes for your queries and your working data set fits in RAM, MongoDB serves all queries from memory.
panels.title: Cache - $service_name

panels.description: The CPU time is measured in clock ticks or seconds. It is useful to measure CPU time as a percentage of the CPU's capacity, which is called the CPU usage.
panels.title: CPU Usage - $node_name

panels.description: When a system is running with maximum CPU utilization, the transmitting and receiving threads must all share the available CPU. This will cause data to be queued more frequently to cope with the lack of CPU. CPU Saturation may be measured as the length of a wait queue, or the time spent waiting on the queue.
panels.title: CPU Saturation and Max Core Usage - $node_name
